file_content.text: Stop right there! I see what you're doing.
How dare you accost the Senator's courier droid? Stealing documents--what's the matter with you?
This is the heart of the Republic, the greatest bastion of democracy in the galaxy!
I'm here to protect the Republic.
I'm doing the right thing.
By breaking the law and undermining the political process? I find that hard to believe.
I don't know what you're talking about.
I'm innocent.
Don't lie! We both know you came here to sabotage Senator Parvil's work.
Leave. Now.
You think you can bully me into disregarding my beliefs? I'm not going anywhere.
I know you people and your drivel about protecting the "true" Republic.
However unpopular Senator Parvil's ideas might be, the principles of the Republic give him the freedom to express those ideas.
The Senator's ideas would destroy the Republic.
Parvil is dangerous.
You don't speak for the Republic, Jedi. Your own order's outdated ideals cause more harm than good.
Jedi stand for peace, not freedom.
That's not my concern.
Then you should recognize that the Senator's plan is the best pathway to peace for the Republic.
You mean let a traitor spread his lies? Not in my Republic.
Not on my watch.
Listen to yourself. This is "our" Republic, not "yours."
And I have the freedom to stop him.
I've got rights, too.
Not according to the laws of the Republic, you don't.
Your opinion of Senator Parvil's ideas doesn't matter. The issues should be decided by political discourse, not political sabotage.
I suppose.
Exactly. Thank you. If you take the Senator's documents, you spit on everything the Republic stands for.
But... the real culprits here are the paranoid fanatics you've gotten yourself tangled up with.
I don't even know who they are.
I'm not with them.
Which is precisely why you should feel no allegiance to them whatsoever.
You're right.
Senator Parvil is the real culprit.
Your boss is the fanatic.
I'll say it one more time. Senator Parvil has every right to exercise his political ideas. It would be criminal to steal his parcel.
Look, it's not too late for you to turn around and do the right thing. I could even forget I saw you.
Sorry. I'm just doing this for the money.
This is just a job.
I should have guessed as much.
Let me propose a way for you to do what's right and still collect your fees.
I have this parcel of out-dated agricultural revenue documents. Give me the Senator's parcel and take these to your friends instead.
The Senator can continue... for now. I'll take back the fakes.
I'll help you out.
You're doing the right thing. I'm glad you recognized the misguided intentions of these fanatics.
On behalf of both the Senator and myself, thank you and good luck.
You're not touching this parcel. I'm going to expose you.
Your Senator's going down.
You're making a mistake. I assure you--Senator Parvil is committed to his principles and I am, too, now more than ever.
You may slow us down, but we will see his plans become reality.
What are you doing here?
